com.googlecode.transmuter.converter
Class Binding

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.transmuter.converter.Binding

public class Binding
extends Object

Represents an immutable invokable object, made binding a method to an object (which may be null if the method is static).

Not all objects, methods or combinations thereof may be bound. Validation is performed in the constructor (using validate), which will throw an exception if the object and the method are deemed invalid or incompatible. The standard validation attempts to ensure that invoke calls will not fail due to a method or object invalidity/incompatibility, i.e. that one cannot build an inherently uninvokable Binding.

Author:
Humberto S. N. dos Anjos

Method Detail

validate

protected void validate(Object instance,
                        Method method)
                 throws BindingInstantiationException
Checks if the given instance and method can be bound. It returns safely if no problem was found.

Several checks are made, each one of them having a corresponding exception on error. If any exceptions are found, they are collected and bundled into a BindingInstantiationException. The checks implemented here are:

  • method may not be null. This violation throws a BindingInstantiationException with a single IllegalArgumentException.
  • method must have public visibility (signals an InaccessibleMethodException).
  • method must be static if instance is null (signals a NullInstanceWithNonStaticMethodException).
  • method must be invokable on instance (signals a MethodInstanceIncompatibilityException).

Parameters:
instance - an object.
method - a method object.
Throws:
BindingInstantiationException - if the given instance and/or method do not constitute a valid binding.

invoke

public Object invoke(Object... args)
              throws BindingInvocationException
Invokes this binding's method object on this binding's instance with the given arguments.

Parameters:
args - the arguments for the method call.
Returns:
the result of this binding's method invoked on this binding's instance with the given arguments.
Throws:
BindingInvocationException - if an exception is thrown during the invocation.

getInstanceClass

public Class<?> getInstanceClass()
Returns the most specific instance class compatible with this binding's instance and method object. That would be the instance's class, if the instance is not null, or the method's declaring class otherwise.

Returns:
the most specific instance class compatible with this binding's instance and method object.

getInstance

public Object getInstance()
Returns this binding's underlying instance. It may be null if this binding represents a static method.

this binding's underlying instance.
